Three years after coup, Myanmar junta chief under unprecedented pressureIn mid-January, at a small gathering in a cantonment town in Myanmar, hard line pro-military monk Pauk Kotaw suggested that the country's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing step down and his deputy take over. The crowd cheered in agreement, according to videos of the event posted on social media. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 06:55:43 GMT 6ULGOXKXRNPRRM3K2MO3HFFF3A https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/third-years-after-coup-myanmar-junta-chief-under-unprecedented-Pressure-2024-01-31/Reuters世界亚太地区
Amer Sports' China reliance weighs on 2024's first big IPO -sourcesAmer Sports' growing reliance on China for its revenue is weighing on the appetite of those considering buying into the sporting equipment maker's $1.8 billion U.S. initial public offering (IPO), four people involved in the process told Reuters. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 06:05:38 GMT TTMUWPMRMZN4FMLJC2JAUC4WNM https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/amer-sports-china-reliance-weighs-2024s-first-big-ipo-sources-2024-01-31/Echo Wang商业零售与消费品
Evergrande's bond holders could wait years for little payout - ratings agencyChina Evergrande's offshore dollar bondholders stand to receive a potentially tiny payout in a complicated process that could take years to play out after the property giant was placed in liquidation, according to S&P Global Ratings. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 05:29:08 GMT LHBY66PLA5KENOMZPNXXFBJXTQ https://www.reuters.com/business/evergrandes-bond-holders-could-wait-years-little-payout- ratings-agency-2024-01-31/Scott Murdoch商业
China issues first development loan under 'project whitelist' mechanism - mediaThe first development loan has been granted under China's so-called "project whitelist" mechanism, the country's official Securities Times reported on Wednesday. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 05:19:27 GMT YWR5SMRTOVKDLA7HLN7BNEZNM4 https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-issues-first-development-loan-under-project-whitelist-mechanism-media-2024-01-31/Reuters世界中国
Chinese major cities ease home purchase limits to boost salesTwo of China's major cities, Suzhou and Shanghai, followed Guangzhou in easing home-buying restrictions, in an effort to boost property sales as persistent weakness in confidence delays a recovery in the crisis-hit property sector. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 05:00:49 GMT WQQEGBC5G5OIBOBNO5RHRKGHLY https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/chinese-major-cities-ease-home-purchase-limits-boost-sales-2024-01-31/Reuters市场亚洲市场
Taiwan president tells Pope Francis she supports his AI concernsTaiwan President Tsai Ing-wen has written to Pope Francis offering support for his concerns over the use of artificial intelligence (AI) and pledging deeper cooperation with the island's sole European ally. Wed, 31 Jan 2024 04:33:22 GMT BYQSSH6J6JNMNFHDNH3WB2F4LU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-president-tells-pope-francis-she-supports-his-ai-concerns-2024-01-31/Reuters世界亚太地区
